This is my first build, so I'm sure it isn't amazing. I debated craft wand and Improved Two Weapon Fighting, because craft wand would be nice for a party. Especially with darkness, since this character has high Hide/Move Silently. I stuffed in a few points of Disable Trap and Open lock, simply for the ability to open locks, and disable traps. I didn't get search, because of the 'Find Trap' spell that is available to bards.

Notes:
-Can get rid of any disable trap skill points, and stuff them into Open Lock. I chose not to, because some player worlds have modified the spell Find Traps to only reveal the traps.
- Craft wand could be useful if you want to get rid of a feat. I'd get rid of Improved Two Weapon Fighting. One less offhand attack, but you still manage 6 attacks/round/ (Including your haste spell.)

Advantages
- High Hide/MS
- Decent AB
- Decent AC
- Versatile
- High Reflex Saves
-Has Open Lock & Disable Trap
- Damage usually scores in the 50's. (7 Attacks per round = 350 Damage.)

Disadvantages
- Not many spell casts
- Doesn't get complete +8 Saves from spellcraft. (Gets +7)
- Low AC Unbuffed
- Attack Bonus is not very high unbuffed

Other Options
-Instead of Bard 20/Rogue 15/Fighter 5, Bard 20 /Rogue 19/SD 1 may be a decent option)

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
This build will have a 20% experience point penalty from level 6 onward. Rogue is the favored class for a halfling, and you have Bard and Fighter more than 2 levels apart.

If you went with Bard 20 / Rogue 16 / CoT 4 instead, you would lose WS / EWS, but keep the 4th attack with the main hand and gain a Rogue bonus feat, as well as freeing up the feat where you can no longer take EWS. Oh, and your saves would all gain +2.

You could also free yourself from the penalty if you keep Fighter and Bard even with each other, like Rogue 19 / Bard 11 / Fighter 10 for example.

Your Shadowdancer version would also be penalty-free because a prestige class never counts towards that penalty.

That could be decent. I thought about maybe taking ranger instead, going Bard 20/Rogue 15/Ranger 5, or Bard 20/Rogue 16/Ranger 4 for free ambidexterity. Also giving me favored enemy. Or, the favored enemy bonus feat could be put to use in epic levels (If I took 5 Ranger), to get an epic bonus feat. Rangers also get extra stealth in areas that are outside.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: You would have the same experience penalty with Ranger as with Fighter, unless you keep it even with Bard. If you are willing to live with the penalty, it is still an option, as is your original version.
